intro: Dendroglossa normalis, commonly known as the common tree frog, is a species of tree frog found in Central and South America. It belongs to the family Hylidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinct coloration, often featuring green or brown hues. The plant aspect of this species refers to its habitat, which includes tropical rainforests and moist environments. Dendroglossa normalis relies on vegetation for shelter and breeding, with females laying eggs on leaves that are submerged in water. Its ecological role contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
